meta_description: Bell County Museum offers quality exhibits, educational interactives, and fun events for the entire family!
hours_text:
# Hours & Directions

**Hours and Directions**  
  
**Hours**  
****12pm - 5pm, Tuesday - Friday  
10am - 5pm, Saturday  
Closed Sundays and Mondays   
  
**Directions**  

  * **From Waco, I-35 Southbound** \- Take Exit 294A toward Central Ave., turn Right on Central Avenue, turn Right on Main St., find Bell County Museum on the Right!

  * **From Austin, I-35 Northbound** \- Take Exit 293A toward TX-317/Main St./ Holland Rd., turn Left onto Holland Rd., turn Right onto Main St., find Bell County Museum on the Right!
admission_text:
# Visit

## Come see us!

The Bell County Museum is located on Main Street in historic Belton, Texas. Located between Waco and Austin on Interstate 35, the museum is easily accessible to county residents and travelers from afar. Our magnificent 1904 Carnegie Library is easy to spot from Main Street.   
  
During your visit, explore the fascinating history of Bell County, be an archaeologist in the Gault Site exhibit, and learn something new in one of our rotating traveling exhibitions.   
  
Come interact with history, science, and culture at the Bell County Museum!  
  
Free Admission.
